review: I'm not a huge fan of Applebee's to start, but relatively speaking this isn't a bad spot. It's attached to the mall so I'm sure it gets super cray around dinner/lunch time but when we came around 11pm it was empty. All of our food and drinks came out on time and everything tasted fresh. They did seat us at the back of the restaurant considering we were a pretty big party and about 7 different waiters helped us for one thing or another (I guess because we were in such an inconvenient spot?). They also only asked my boyfriend and I for ID for drinks because "You guys look too young", which is embarrassing when they didn't ask anyone else. However, in general, it was a pretty good experience.

I don't expect much from a chain like this, but this was a Horrible Experience!  The staff was less than friendly and hardly helpful.  They almost seemed annoyed that I was there. The food was also undercooked. An all around bad experience.

We came here to eat on a Sunday night when it was decently busy. We didn't have to wait long which was a plus but our dinner ended up being over two hours due to the slow and rude service. Our waitress was less than happy to be there and acted as if we were an inconvience on her night. When I asked where our lemonades were in a polite manner, she responded by saying very harshly and an eye role saying that the bartender was still making them. Would have been nice to know during one of the three times she walked passed us. The food itself was bland and the night ended with the waitress giving us a chipper fairwell. I guess she expected a night of rudeness would be rewarded with a good tip. She also forgot to give me my debit card back and I had to go back to retrieve that which was annoying. Overall, avoid this location.

Rude, ghetto waitress. Gave us attitude, still not sure why...maybe that's just how she was raised. Afterwards, served my wife a diet coke with some kind of weird plastic toy inside. She didn't bother drinking it.  Food was pretty bland.  Left the place in regret.

Update:  I went back to this location only because I got a BOGO coupon for my birthday for a free entree.  Though there were still no windows on the wall facing the inside of the mall, the waiter this time was a LOT better than the one we had the time before.  The food was fine.  My steak had a little too much pepper for my taste, but it was cooked to the correct temperature. It took a long time for my drink order to get to me from the bar, but when it did come, the manager brought it and apologized for the wait (I hadn't even asked about the drink yet!). The waiter wasn't 100% on-point, because I asked for some extra chips after finishing with the ones in the Spinach and Artichoke Dip appetizer (to finish the dip), and we didn't GET the chips until after dinner AND me asking again.  I'm pretty sure it was the waiter who forgot because after I reminded him, they came out of the kitchen within 5 minutes. Definitely a better experience than my first visit here, but I'd still opt for an Applebee's that's a little farther away that has better service.

The 550 calorie parmesan lemon shrimp was tasty but i was not a fan that it was served over rice. The appetizer trio was gross, quesadilla towers were nasty, artichoke dip was tasteless and the boneless bbq chicken strips are not worth the calories.

My girlfriend and I walk in and the hostess ran out of utensils to put on our table and din't even bother to get us some. Our waitress though was nice but didn't give us utensils either until after we got our food.  We just shared the appetizer sampler which tasted pretty much not so frozen food anymore. The mozzarella sticks were good the first bite but then you knew they were not freshly made. The boneless wings were not all sauced and chewy. The Artichoke dip was bland while the nachos were salty. And the cheese Quesadilla was just ok.  The place itself was bigger than I expected. They have a bunch of TV's everywhere. I would have rather gotten food at the food court.

If I could, I would give this place NEGATIVE stars. My boyfriend and I came here to give Applebee's a try since we don't have any in Hawaii. We were seated promptly. Six waitresses walked by us several times and they just looked at us and didn't ask if we needed anything. HORRIBLE customer service. We waited 20 minutes and weren't even served water so we walked out. The hostesses at the door didn't even notice us walk out. They were too busy on their phones. We walked by about 30 minutes later and the menus were still there. DON'T EVER EAT AT THIS LOCATION.

Awful service. Slow, waiter didn't bring utensils until the appetizers came and we asked, didn't bring honey mustard, other servers ignored me when I tried to signal them after our server didn't come by for a while. Food was pretty good though.

Our flight home was cancelled, and we were stuck in Newark, New Jersey.  We didn't know the area but when we couldn't get out on Saturday, I looked for a new hotel to stay at that was close to anything within walking distance.  We found this Applebee's at The Outlet Collection: Jersey Gardens. There was a little confusion at the host stand, but the hostess said 15 minutes, and it was actually 5.  We were given a table by the bar and in front of the kitchen doors, so we got to see the food coming out.  Some of it looked really good and some just average.  Our server, Ibn, stopped by and said he'd be with us shortly.  I didn't realize how deep the restaurant went.   We ordered two glasses of the Shiraz and fried mozzarella sticks.  It had been a while since we've eaten these gooey fried sticks that are not good for you but hey, we're still on vacation.  We also asked if they sold the wines by the bottle.  The only red we could get was a Cabernet by Cupcake.  I've seen this label, and the $30 price tag seemed steep considering you could buy this at Trader Joe's or Costco for much less, but we wanted wine!  I don't think people order bottles at Applebee's because our server said he'd never opened a bottle before.  The bartender ended up doing it for him. He: I'm just going to make a mess, so I'm going to leave it here for you. Luckily I still remember my food service skills...LOL!  I ordered the Napa Chicken and portobellos.  It is a very healthy dish with zucchini, purple onions, and red bell peppers.  I just wished the mushrooms were sauteed longer.  The partner had the honey peppered sirloin which was tender and easy to cut.  We did have to wait awhile for that bottle to arrive, but again, I don't think most people order bottles. Overall, it was a very nice dining experience.  A couple of the managers came by to ask how everything was.  Did we look like corporate?  LOL!  I can see how things can get a little chaotic, but all the workers we encountered were friendly.  We didn't encounter anything the other reviewers experienced.  Maybe we had their best server.  With not that many choices for us to walk to, this Applebee's was worth coming to.

If I can I would give this place negative 0 stars! By far the worse service I've ever had in my life. Hostess was nice and quick. Our server didn't write down our order and she claimed she didn't cause she was good at her job. She didn't give us plates or napkins for our appetizer sampler. The patron margarita tasted like water. My sizzling fajita skillet was cold and not sizzling. My fried wanted fries and mashed pots with his honey chicken and shrimp and she didn't bring it out like that! Maybe if she would of wrote it down she wouldn't of forgot! She forgot my guacamole and my wraps. Kim also charged me for the guac after not recieving it! I had to eat it like that cause she took so long. She didn't bring us refills after being asked. She brought out our brownie with NO ice cream!! And no spoons. I'm a Applebee's employee but in another location and I expected better service then this !! She was very slow and forgot us and her other tables were also complaining about her. I love going out to eat but this place needs to retrain or hire new servers and cooks ASAP! Never coming here again and most definitely will let my colleagues know not to dine in such horrible atmosphere!

For me, Applebee's is the abusive relationship of restaurants. He/She doesn't treat you right, none of your friends understand what you see in him/her, and you always walk away promising yourself you'll never go back.... And then you're stuck in a mall when you stomach rumbles...and you think to yourself "Maybe it's changed...maybe it really wasn't so bad" So you go back. And, true to form, the food leaves you with a figurative "black eye". I don't like Applebees. Why do I do this to myself? Alas, the above "Mall stomach rumble" scenario happened to me while at the Jersey Garden's mall. I thought I would stop in for a better quality lunch than what one typically finds in the food court. And, thus, my first Yelp 1 star dining experience ensued.... As other posts noted, the hostess was fine. Greeted me courteously, seated me promptly. All was right with the world. Then, the fun began. I was seated next to the service station. Not across from, not a few tables away from....NEXT to the serving station. Imagine my surprise when it took quite some time for the server to recognize I was sitting in his section. Aside from the time it took to get noticed, the service as fine. The real blow came with the food. I ordered a lunch combo of the Fiesta Chopped Chicken Salad, and the Artisan Grilled Chicken Ciabatta. Now, I think most people that know me know I eat just about anything, and really don't complain. Let this be the lens with which you view this next statement. They were both TERRIBLE! (Charles Barkley/Taco Bell style TURRIBLE:  ).  The salad nearly blew my tastebuds out, in a bad way! Normally I like really flavorful food, but this was so bad I wondered if Ashton Kutcher was going to pop out to tell me I was being Punk'd. The salad looked like it was dressed with the bottom portion of an Italian Dressing bottle - you know, all the little bits and pieces...and then had tons of oil. I almost took a picture to prove my point, but I didn't think the image would come out. As for the sandwich - pray tell, what exactly qualifies it to receive the "Artisan" title? It looked like a Chik Fil-A sandwich. As for the condiments on the sandwich. I like to imagine the cook had an arm injury that made it too difficult to spread the condiments across the entire sandwich. That is honestly the only explanation. Avoid this place. Applebee's doesn't really love you, despite what it might say. It's going to fall back into the same old pattern, and there's only so many times you can use the "I hit my eye on a cupboard" excuse.

Went here 2 weeks ago and I've been dying to write about how much this apple b's sucks.  Sat to have dinner with some friends and the waiter girl came and basically laid the whole front half of her body over the table which was weird. And then every 5 mins she would come and do the same thing and ask if we needed something else. We ordered a berry sangria pitcher, when she brought it to the table I was like whoaa yess That's a lot but, there was only enough in the whole pitcher for 2 small wine glasses and a half!  The whole thing was filled to the top with ice creating the illusion of it being filled with the actual drink. She kept asking if we wanted more which was kinda annoying too. In all this has to be the worst apple b's and, restaurant in general I've ever been to in my life, I wish I would've read the reviews before coming.

They only have ranch , blue cheese and honey mustard drassing.......really I ordered a rare steak and that didn't happen ......well done My peach sangria was the worst ever.....The worst Applebee's experience ever... The manager came over and was no help.....The worst

THE WORST Applebee's experience EVER! We got here around 10:40 so it was about 10 people in there TOPS. The servers are standing near the bar dancing & talking about a beach trip tomorrow took 11 minutes until someone came & took our order. Asked my husband what he wanted didn't return the favor to me strike one. Brought him his drink took off again to clean a table without even asking if we were ready to order. We ordered a chocolate meltdown it was good, can't really mess that up BUT it took another 14 minutes to get the bill, another 5 for her to take the check then the cherry on too was not bringing us back all of our change. I will NEVER go to this Applebee's again. Ghetto Gardens.

This is the worst applebees ever!!!! Never again our waitress Britney was horrible we waited 40 minutes to not even get a second drink. The whole time we were there she didnt even come to our table I had to ask another waitress for a clean fork. Yet Britney was quick to give is the check but not check on us at least once. When I did get my food it was half cold. I will never be going back to this place

I was visiting from Colorado and my 2 friends were visiting from London, England.  We had the party platter. We each had our favorites and it was good.  The drinks are a little weak for my taste but yummy. Try the Strawberry Margarita!
I wish I could rate 0. The pasta was under cooked, then they took it back for cooking but not even close to fully cooked.  Then they missed my husband's order of a beer. The worst experience!!

The service is good, I like that we have been seated right away whenever we come. My wife and I like that the managers normally come by the table to make sure everything is going good. On this particular night, we did not see any managers though.

I was at Applebee's since 12 pm with no problems. I had two beers and a shot of Johnny walker. I had a salad because their food is either a hit or miss kind of deal. Later on I had another beer and their steak with Pappas (potatoes). Long story short, the bartender "V," told her boss that she was cutting me off and I wasn't acting rude to her or the other bartender. I guess my Spanish was extremely bad that she thought I was drunk. So don't speak Spanish to impress because "V" will cut you off from having drinks. Additionally, if you leave a big tip at the bar and it's not for "V" she will throw it away like it was never there. Most importantly, if "V" doesn't appreciate your business she will talk about you to whomever speaks spanish. Warning, stay clear of Veronica Mars.

Okay, I was there on a Sunday night. I don't know who our server was but it was Puerto Rican woman. I think she might be a lesbian. And if she's a lesbian, she definitely wears the pants in the relationship. Her sexual orientation isn't a problem obviously but I need to state this so you guys know who I'm talking about. I don't think that I should have to ask my server for utensils. It should just be there when the food arrives. And please don't take your time getting me utensils so I have to eat the food when it gets cold with the utensils you were "forced" to get me. Asshole.  And we needed refills. I should not have to go up to the bar and ask the bartender for refills because you want to sit down THE WHOLE TIME I'M FUCKING THERE AND PLAY PATTYCAKE WITH THE OTHER WORKERS. And please do come and ask, "how is everything?" instead of saying, "yo, you guys good?". Classless. I felt sick leaving a tip.

Awful service! Never go to this Applebee's! I went with a friend Friday night. It was fairly busy but not too busy and not packed. We get seated, and we wait 20 minutes before I literally had to get a servers attention. The server who helped us was pretty good and apologetic, but the guy who was supposed to serve us finally came to our table 30 minutes after we were seated.  30 minutes later!!! I had to force a server to come to my table after 20 minutes, and then the server who was supposed to help me comes over. Not only did he pretend like nothing was wrong, he actually lied about why he didn't come over sooner! I was furious and sent him away. Calling corporate on Monday. Never going to this place ever again, terrible location.

Might be the worst bartenders I have ever experienced! Bad service, slow, nasty to customers, and just downright bad attitudes! Being part of a shopping mall and close to many hotels, one would think they would bend over backwards and welcome business in an area of New Jersey surrounded by shipping containers and industrial complexes! Not so here. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!

With only a food court in the immediate vicinity, w opted to go for Applebee's:  A franchise we usually pass on.  Our bellies were calling for lunch after a morning marathon of shopping, and this is what we settled on: Grilled salmon:  cooked well, seasoned lightly, and served over vegetables.  Harmless, and unmemorable. Thai Shrimp Salad:  slightly under cooked shrimp, some greens, thai peanut dressing in a super small portion.  What did I expect for under 400 calories?  Not much more...just some more time on he grill for those shrimp.  I ate them, and I'm still alive. Service was fine, plenty of suggestive upselling from our server, cell phone use from the other band of merry servers that, with most of their "street"-like attitudes shouldn't have been in the hospitality business at all. If you're like me and don't relish eating in food courts like me, steer clear of this and find another joint to spend your dough.

I took the veggie burger. Absolutely disgusting (when will applebeas improve the veggie options?). Had to put so much barbeque in order it be eatable. Had to almost beg for the barbeque as our server went somewhere and the other server we asked from was too lazy to bring it by himself. My friend took blackend tilapia, he liked it.

Sat at a table for 6... with 2 of us... not exactly the best use of space. Given a Spanish menu and suspect it is because they assumed my girlfriend was spanish... failed. Given a dirty glass... failed. The music is so loud, they can't hear me order... failed. I have no idea if they heard me... applebees is what it is. This place is well under corporate standards. So.. I received two bowls of vegetables and no main dish... (I ordered 1 bowl of vegetables as part of the meal)... major fail. The cause is easily the loud music that prevents people from communicating and the disinterest in being here on the staffs part. Not a place I will return to.

Alcoholic drinks were too sour I kept pouring my water in my margarita to tolerate it. I found something weird in my mashed potato which was either burned potato piece or rib bone that fell on your steak plate. Didn't get a discount just a sorry from the manager who probably doesnt't care. Not coming back to this one ever again.
Good food and service can't complain. Would visit again. Lot of people due to holiday weekend but food came quickly and was very hot and delicious.

The worst customer service I've ever experienced. Absolutely terrible. I went to Applebee's with a few friends and we were left waiting for our food for over 40 minutes and when the food got there it was in the smallest portions and I've been to other Applebee's and the portion of the food was completely different. I honestly do not recommend this Applebee's to anyone, they will be rude and disrespectful, leave you waiting, and have terrible quality in the food itself.

This is by far THE BEST APPLE BEES IVE BEEN TOO. And I've been to over 30 in New Jersey and New York total. The wait was less than 20 minutes. The waiter we had was amazing Thank God. The food was also amazing. OMG I've never tasted such goodness and savory sauces in one dish. We had the steak and shrimp Parmesan and it was so so so good. I give it 20/10 stars. And my boyfriend had the 4 cheese w/ chicken tenders and my god that was to die for. We also had the blackberry ice tea and I hate ice tea, but after trying my boyfriends own I m now an Applebee's iced tea lover. Thank you apple bees for a wonderful experience!

This place is falling apart, No service at all... Asked for loaded mashes, got loaded french fries witch was charged $2.50 for nasty fake cheese, tried getting the attention of other serves and was ignored my server was nowhere to be found, Manager was notified that we wanted to speak with him and never came to the table, floors are dirty, like I understand this is in Elizabeth but for gods sake do your job. I would never be coming here again and would recommend no-one to go either.

Apple Bee's food and service has gone down so much recently. We have had bad experiences at other Apple Bee's locations and thought it was just that particular one. Nope, my theory is that all Apple Bee's are crumbling down. This place is located inside the Jersey Gardens Mall. When we went to this place it was around lunch time. It wasn't busy at all but the service was slow. The servers took a while to take our drink orders and then when they finally did we had to wait a while for the food to come out. I don't mind waiting for good food but it tasted like frozen food and reheated. I ordered the steak, vegetables, and mash potatoes. The steak was chewy and the vegetables was very bland. I would rather go to the food court than eat at this place again.

Just walked out of Applebee's and I can say I had excellent service by a wonderful server  (Jorlin). Ordered 2 apps and 3 entrees. The apps were nice and hot and yummy. 2 out of 3 entrees were cooked well and when I sent my meal back, they were nothing but apologetic.  My server kept checking on me and the status of my meal and apologizing even though it was out of his control. By the time my meal came to me, my party had finished eating. It was cooked properly though and they comped it to make up for the inconvenience.  I have eaten at this Applebee's before and I will eat here again because I always get good customer service.

I don't know about ya'l, but after a really bad experience at Applebee's Hackensack, this place is heaven! Today, I wanted to eat something quick, and Jersey Gardens doesn't have the greatest array of food options, so I figured to stop at Applebee's. I sat at the bar and the bartender, Tashiona, was sweet, proper, and fast. I gave her my order, she left me my check, and I closed my tab out immediately. I ordered a White Peach Sangria, which was light and sweet (order this only if like sweet drinks). I got the new Grilled Onion Sirloin, which was delicious. I loved the seasoned tomatoes and the sauce. Thanks for making me believe in Applebee's again!

Awful. Service was pathetic. Tables covered in garbage and trash on the floor, despite several employees standing around doing nothing. I think we saw our waitress once. Food was ice cold. Will never return.

Filthy filthy filthy. Oh, it's also very filthy. Started off by being sat before cleaning the table. Attached are photos of the booth. Employees too lazy to even attempt to get trash or wipe behind the back of the U-shaped booth. Hot food came out cold. Friend's fries were even cold. Salad was full of wilted lettuce, and small bugs flying around it. Wasn't even correct salad. Advised server and she swapped salad out. It was correct second time around. Server is very pleasant, although not frequent. Music is loud and obnoxious, can't hear people talking at your own table. So if you want to come alone and eat, it's perfect. Otherwise, don't expect to have much verbal communication. Floors seem clean. But thankful I'm unaware of kitchen cleanliness status.

No stars. VERY racist and rude staff. Seat by demographic, so unless you're white and pristine looking. Don't come here, you will have to wait hours to be seated.  Manager is a rude ass too. Do not come here !  Wish I could give NO STARS.

Great place to eat, my waiter Malcom B, was very nice attentive food came in time and the food was hot, his personality was great and humble, that you for a great service and great food see you guys again soon....!! Applebee's....!!!

One star it's a bonus. These guys don't know the difference between white a red wine - we asked for Pinot Grigio and got red wine - twice. After thirty minutes of waiting the waitress took our order, another twenty minutes waiting for the food -  one of the two dishes wrong, not what he had ordered. We paid for our drinks and left, staff was unapologetic, a group of young workers that obviously don't care.

If zero stars were an option, this would be it. During our lunch visit, waitress tried to scam us with an unauthorized 30% tip charge. She returned credit card without receipt and kept distance. Waitress was also not attentive to us and offered no refills on our drinks despite the cups being empty for majority of the meal. Would not return and all who plan to dine at this Applebee's please be cautious.
Food was ok but don't get fool with the portion ! Geezz!! Steak salad sucks here overall I didn't enjoy anything

I should have known the food was going to be bad. The quality at this food chain has significantly gotten worse over the last few years. The staff was okay to say the least. We order 2 steak entrees - I ordered mine medium and my sister ordered hers well done. The well done steak came out burnt and the medium came out how a well done steak should have come out. The fries were so stale I couldn't eat them (and I'm a fry fanatic). What a disappointment. Definitely the last time I'll be visiting an Applebees.

The food wasn't too bad but the service made it a terrible experience. Our waitress came by the table 2 times. Everyone else ran our food out I had to eat my steak without a drink because we didn't see our waitress at all until we were done with our food. My husband tried to get the managers attention and she thought he was trying to flirt with her and gave him a weird look, she passed by our table multiple times and did not ask once if we needed anything or even notice we needed drink refils. So if the manager didn't notice nor care to check in why would our waitress? As a former server at Applebees I can honestly say I was horrified by the experience. Also, the bathroom was disgusting..the were feces on the toliet seat. Never going back there again.
Poor service, poor food, poor portions and visually just not looking tasty. deff not what I would expect from a chain this size.

Terrible service! Manager is unprofessional.  Came here a few times and service was way below average.  First time I visited this location was with my boyfriend. Waitress came to us maybe twice. It was alittle late close to closing time and I totally understand that everyone wants to go home but that is no excuse to not tend to your table. When we finished our entrees we waited, and I timed it, twenty minutes for our waitress to come check on us. She came over and just handed the check, we stopped her from walking away and said, but we wanted to order dessert and she said "oh well, kitchen is closed" like what??!? This is your fault you waited til the kitchen closed to then come to our table and make sure we couldn't order anything else.  Second time was with friends, this time they had no ice cream for their desserts. Manager was rude about it.  Never visit this location!

Worst experience at an Applebee's I have ever had. After being seated had to wait 15 minutes just to order drinks. Ordered 3 appetizers, 20 minutes later received 1 app. 45 minutes later still no food. Didn't see waiter who took my order the entire time also. Watched as the employs stood around talking to each other while I was starving. Left, drove to Jersey City Applebee's which was packed but received my entire order in 20 minutes.

I expected a Good service but instead we had very unpleasant time. I'll start with the staff by saying stay off your phones. It looks bad when you see most of them on their phones in groups and they were not paying attention to the costumers our food took longer to get to our table, again it looks bad. I even took a picture but i will not go that far. I wonder who was the manager on Sunday Around 3pm and if she/he was aware of it, 'cmon if you run a business you need to run it like it No wonder why food service is disappointing  I don't recommend this place

Applebees is a really family friendly place and a nice place to eat for the kids when you just finished shopping in the mall that it is located. It isn't very hard to find and the food is pretty good. They have relatively well priced there and to save money, me and my friend got the 2 for $20 offer for one appetizer and two entrees. The boneless wings we chose to be spicy were not that spicy which might be good for others but we wanted spicy not mild. There was a lot of dough on the wings which didn't taste that good, but the pasta that I ordered made up for it.

The reviews of this Applebee's are low for a reason. I am not a fan of Applebee's, but frequent more than I care to due to various reasons. With that being said, this is the absolute worst Applebee's that I've ever visited. I won't even bother with a detailed review, the best thing about this place is the host at the front (young man with glasses). The servers are not attentive, took 45 minutes and complaining to get our drinks (tap water and soft drinks) and an additional hour and some change to get our meals.  FIND ELSEWHERE TO EAT!

Applebees in general is basically small step up from a burger king.  But the food is decent sometimes.  This is Elizabeth.  It's crowded and too busy sometimes.  The Elizabeth crowd is really what ruins the experience.  If you are from Elizabeth then you may be used to and it may not bother you.  If you are a civilized,decent and remotely cultured human being you would hate this place on a weekend.  You'll get sat next a some criminal trying to sell low quality weed on his metro pcs android phone.  You'll see plenty of single moms pushing ugly babies around.  Applebees is ok Elizabeth is straight
Great experience, good food Applebee's is one of my favorite place to visit. They always have a good happy hour menu plus the to entrees+ one appetizer for just $20 what a wonderful thing

Applebee's at Jersey Garden was one of the worst place i've visited during my stay at the NY area. I had to be seated at an uncleaned table with a rude worker. The staffs were sweeping the floor with a broom stick while I was enjoying my meal, and when I was rating / surveying my stay at the place, the staff was watching how I was rating them over my shoulders. Cheap, okay taste, but THE WORST EXPERIENCE ever. I wouldn't visit ever again, and wouldn't recommend anyone to go there and spend dollars.

Worst Applebee's I've probably ever been to, the service was exceptionally horrible, the hostess (Kayla) was rolling her eyes whenever a group would walk into the establishment. The food was alright however it had a freezer burn type of taste. And every employee had an attitude to them. Overall it was a very unpleasant dining experience. Wold not recommend to anyone

Meh. It's just a regular Applebee's location. Really nothing special about this place. The food is also okay. It's just a restaurant you visit when you've run out of options. I find the restaurant soundtrack here pretty cool and laid back. The waiters are also very nice.

Come with low expectations and you will be fine. Located in the Jersey Gardens Mall, Applebees is convenient for hangry shoppers that require something more than fast food which includes an alcoholic beverage post holiday shopping.  The food is very basic. Chicken & parmesan pasta was fine. Chicken, French fries with flavorless broccoli, meh.  My margarita sat at the bar long before it was brought to my table.
